page.title: 06ANIMAL HUSBANDRY
page.content: Dairying is mainly Friesian herds. The quality of milk is high,a high proportion of it used for butter & cheesemaking. Summer milking away from farms using porter tanks. Calves bred for replacements in herd or fattening. Sheep produce lambs for meat & wool. Due to mild weather lambs can be produced in winter for Spring markets. Health of stock is maintained by regular drenching or injections against worms, especially liver fluke, which is prevalent in this low lying area. Regular sheep dipping is compulsory to control disease. Sales of milk in bulk go through the Milk Marketiing Board, collected daily in large tankers. Cattle & sheep are taken to local Markets.
